p: These viral vector-borne diseases are also circulating in the Central African region. This is illustrated by CHIKV outbreaks in Kinshasa in both 2000 [ 18] and 2012 [ 19] and Brazzaville in 2011 [ 20], and the 2013 DENV [ 21] and 2016 yellow fever virus (YFV) outbreak in Angola [ 22], along with the first Zika virus (ZIKV) case reported in Angola in 2017 [ 23]. These outbreaks are only possible because the Aedes mosquito, the vector of the aforementioned arboviruses, thrives in this region. Furthermore, although not conclusive for vector competence and local transmission capability, alphaviruses (chikungunya) and flaviviruses (species not specified) were demonstrated by RT-PCR in Aedes mosquitoes in Kinshasa in 2014 [ 24].
